Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Edison Energy is a global energy advisory firm that helps large corporate, industrial, and institutional clients better navigate the choices, opportunities, and risks that will emerge from the transition to a net-zero future.
As stakeholder expectations around corporate sustainability increase, Edison helps companies rise to this challenge by designing and implementing individualized strategies, projects, and programs across sustainability, renewables, transportation electrification, energy optimization, and energy supply.
Edison enables organizations to deliver on their strategic, financial, and sustainability goals by addressing today’s key energy challenges: carbon, cost, complexity, and creating energy equity across communities.
Edison Energy LLC is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Edison International (NYSE: EIX) and does business in Europe as Altenex Energy.

Position Overview:

Title: Sr Vegetation Management Program Manager
Job_Description:
Description
Be a part of something powerful at America's leading energy provider!

At Exelon, our people are the heart and soul of our business. Whether it's powering lives, supporting communities or collaborating with colleagues, an Exelon employee is talented, compassionate, forward-thinking and inspired. We are a Fortune 200 company united by our values and shared vision for a cleaner and brighter future. We encourage curiosity, value diverse perspectives and we never stop looking for ways to be, work and do better. We know the future is in our hands. That's why we're looking for people like you, who have the power to make a difference.

As the nation's largest utility company, we serve more than 10 million customers through six fully regulated transmission and distribution utilities - Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power & Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco). All 18,000 of us are committed to delivering safe, reliable and affordable energy to our customers, strengthening our communities, supporting a clean energy future and reducing our impact on the changing climate.

Our people are empowered to evolve and advance their careers in an open and inclusive environment. We pride ourselves on being the kind of place where people want to come, stay and grow - whether that's in the role and path they start in or in new and exciting career opportunities across our business. We know that investing in our employees' futures strengthens ours, which is why we offer competitive compensation, incentives, opportunities for career path changes, and health and retirement benefits.

Title: Sr Vegetation Management Program Manager
Job_Description:
In-Charge Energy is an energy solutions company that is accelerating electrification of transportation by providing a comprehensive, scalable electric fleet charging infrastructure solutions. We tailor our systems to private and public commercial fleets, electric vehicle OEMs, ride-share operators, municipalities, and commercial facilities owners. The founding team is the most experienced team in EV charging, with executive leadership from Tesla, NRG Energy, EVgo, ABM, innogy eMobility, Ford Motor Company, Honeywell and Edison International. The company concluded a Series A fundraising round in January 2020 with Macquarie Capital, the world’s largest infrastructure asset manager, and ABB, the global electrical equipment leader.
Position Summary:
In-Charge, a high-growth company in vehicle fleet electrification, seeks a Lead Quality Assurance Engineer. The selected candidate will be responsible for establishing an efficient QA process that can be scaled and evolved as the company changes, leading the QA team, and creating/adjusting test plans, scripts, and templates for testing documentation.

Title: Sr Vegetation Management Program Manager
Job_Description:
InCharge Energy is an energy solutions company that is accelerating electrification of transportation by providing a comprehensive, scalable electric fleet charging infrastructure solution. We tailor our systems to private and public commercial fleets, electric vehicle OEMs, ride-share operators, municipalities, and commercial facilities owners. The founding team is the most experienced team in EV charging, with executive leadership from Tesla, NRG Energy, EVgo, ABM, innogy eMobility, Ford Motor Company, Honeywell and Edison International. The company concluded a Series A fundraising round in January 2020 with Macquarie Capital, the world’s largest infrastructure asset manager, and ABB, the global electrical equipment leader. InCharge Energy also recently announced key partnerships with Ryder Truck, Navistar, and Lonestar Specialty Vehicles.

Job Description:
At InCharge, we owe our success to the efficiency of organizational processes. To help maintain and grow this standard, we’re seeking an experienced Production Manager to oversee daily activities in our Richmond, Virginia office. The ideal candidate will have a sharp business mind and proven success managing construction, service or production teams. Additionally, they’ll display a proven ability to develop and maintain an environment of trust, diversity, and inclusion within their team. Their ultimate responsibility is to drive operational process under OSHA required safety measures on track.

Title: Sr Vegetation Management Program Manager
Job_Description:
InCharge Energy is an energy solutions company that is accelerating electrification of transportation by providing a comprehensive, scalable electric fleet charging infrastructure solution. We tailor our systems to private and public commercial fleets, electric vehicle OEMs, ride-share operators, municipalities, and commercial facilities owners. The founding team is the most experienced team in EV charging, with executive leadership from Tesla, NRG Energy, EVgo, ABM, innogy eMobility, Ford Motor Company, Honeywell and Edison International. The company concluded a Series A fundraising round in January 2020 with Macquarie Capital, the world’s largest infrastructure asset manager, and ABB, the global electrical equipment leader. InCharge Energy also recently announced key partnerships with Ryder Truck, Navistar, and Lonestar Specialty Vehicles.

Job Description:
The Shipping and Logistics Coordinator is responsible for sending the finished goods (like EV Charger, transformer and auxiliary equipment) to their final destination. The coordinator needs to be highly organized and understand the processes that drive a warehouse, as well as production constraints at the manufacturing facility. Collaboration with Supply Chain Lead, Warehouse Manager, and Project Teams to prioritize and manage the outgoing shipments according to the company’s needs. In addition, this position is expected to live and breathe by the SIOP-Process that is currently implemented and provide the needed feedback from the shipping requests that are being submitted.

Title: Sr Vegetation Management Program Manager
Job_Description:
InCharge Energy is an energy solutions company that is accelerating electrification of transportation by providing a comprehensive, scalable electric fleet charging infrastructure solution. We tailor our systems to private and public commercial fleets, electric vehicle OEMs, ride-share operators, municipalities, and commercial facilities owners. The founding team is the most experienced team in EV charging, with executive leadership from Tesla, NRG Energy, EVgo, ABM, innogy eMobility, Ford Motor Company, Honeywell and Edison International. The company concluded a Series A fundraising round in January 2020 with Macquarie Capital, the world’s largest infrastructure asset manager, and ABB, the global electrical equipment leader. InCharge Energy also recently announced key partnerships with Ryder Truck, Navistar, and Lonestar Specialty Vehicles.

Job Description:
The Warehouse Administrator is responsible for handling the administrative tasks around the commissioning and material handling team in the Richmond facility. The administrator needs to be highly organized and understand the processes that drive a warehouse. Collaboration with Supply Chain Lead, Warehouse Lead, and Shipping and Logistics Coordinator to communicate stock levels. In addition, this position is expected to coordinate information flow on behalf of the Warehouse Lead and relay feedback.

Seeking qualified Software Engineers w/Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in ENGG OR CS OR IT and 6 months of experience to Develop and Provide engineering support to the design, development, and qualification of products, processes, and process equipment in accordance with TMC QA101 Product Development & Design Controls and in full compliance with all design control, quality, and company regulations and national and international regulatory body requirements. evaluates the severity of control deficiencies, assists process owners in remediation efforts,

Title: GE Gas Power - Edison Engineering Development Program (EEDP) 2023
Job_Description:
Join the Clean Energy Revolution
Become a Telecom Engineer 2 at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll perform telecommunications engineering tasks on projects with a moderate financial and operational impact on the Company. You will analyze telecommunications requirements, produce high level project costs and labor estimates, design telecommunications systems, initiate capital work orders, place orders for procurement of equipment, develop detailed installation job instructions and documentation, develop, and lead schedules and track project progress. Your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions, and build cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?
A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright!
System Design: Provide telecommunications systems (MPLS, fiber optic, microwave, satellite, mobile radio) and circuits design. Guide the design of facilities such as communications rooms and towers to meet project and system objectives while considering a wide variety of sophisticated factors such as environmental constraints, terrain, accessibility, availability of power, and proximity to other SCE facilities. Evaluate existing designs to make recommendations regarding deployment of new systems and network equipment.

At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. This job description is not all inclusive, however, this will outline the primary functions and responsibilities required to fill the position of Director - Safety Health and Environmental. This position reports to the Vice President, Global Operations – Color Solutions.

Locations

Brampton, ON Canada – Girardota, Colombia – Medellin, Colombia – Sao Paulo, Brazil – Queretaro, Mexico – Montevideo, Uruguay – Ashtabula, OH – Lockland, OH – Norcross, GA – Edison, NJ – Sittard, Netherlands – Maastricht, Netherlands – Menen, Belgium – Alsfeld, Germany – Colditz, Germany – Vantaa, Finland – Doicesti, Romania – Johannesburg, South Africa – Llidio, Spain – Barcelona, Spain – Gardenia, Spain- Shanghai, China – Mumbai, India – Chennai, India – Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia – 2 locations in Dandenong, Australia

Safety First

Communication/Other Duties

Education and Additional Requirements

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is required to stand; walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.

Working Conditions

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the responsibilities of this Job, the employee will be in a plant environment the majority of the time with high noise level.

Title: Senior Process Simulation Engineer- Solid Mechanics
Job_Description:
Join the Clean Energy Revolution
Become a Telecom Engineer 2 at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll perform telecommunications engineering tasks on projects with a moderate financial and operational impact on the Company. You will analyze telecommunications requirements, produce high level project costs and labor estimates, design telecommunications systems, initiate capital work orders, place orders for procurement of equipment, develop detailed installation job instructions and documentation, develop, and lead schedules and track project progress. Your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions, and build cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?
A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright!
System Design: Provide telecommunications systems (MPLS, fiber optic, microwave, satellite, mobile radio) and circuits design. Guide the design of facilities such as communications rooms and towers to meet project and system objectives while considering a wide variety of sophisticated factors such as environmental constraints, terrain, accessibility, availability of power, and proximity to other SCE facilities. Evaluate existing designs to make recommendations regarding deployment of new systems and network equipment.

Title: Senior Process Simulation Engineer- Solid Mechanics
Job_Description:
In-Charge Energy is an energy solutions company that is accelerating electrification of transportation by providing a comprehensive, scalable electric fleet charging infrastructure solutions. We tailor our systems to private and public commercial fleets, electric vehicle OEMs, ride-share operators, municipalities, and commercial facilities owners. The founding team is the most experienced team in EV charging, with executive leadership from Tesla, NRG Energy, EVgo, ABM, innogy eMobility, Ford Motor Company, Honeywell and Edison International. The company concluded a Series A fundraising round in January 2020 with Macquarie Capital, the world’s largest infrastructure asset manager, and ABB, the global electrical equipment leader.
Position Summary:
In-Charge, a high-growth company in vehicle fleet electrification, seeks a Senior Backend Engineer with experience building GraphQL APIs with Elixir. You care about security, code quality, scalability, performance, and simplicity. You are willing to take on challenges, be highly motivated and work effectively both on a team and independently.

Who We Are
At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. Title: Senior Process Simulation Engineer- Solid Mechanics
Job_Description:
Edison Energy is a global energy advisory firm that helps large corporate, industrial, and institutional clients better navigate the choices, opportunities, and risks that will emerge from the transition to a net-zero future.
As stakeholder expectations around corporate sustainability increase, Edison helps companies rise to this challenge by designing and implementing individualized strategies, projects, and programs across sustainability, renewables, transportation electrification, energy optimization, and energy supply.
Edison enables organizations to deliver on their strategic, financial, and sustainability goals by addressing today’s key energy challenges: carbon, cost, complexity, and creating energy equity across communities.
Edison Energy LLC is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Edison International (NYSE: EIX) and does business in Europe as Altenex Energy.

Title: Energy Analyst (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Job Description

Join the Clean Energy Revolution
In this job, the Business Operations Analyst, Sr. Specialist will be part of the Fire Investigation team within Wildfire Mitigation Strategy (WMS). The successful candidate will work with the Engineering team performing fire investigations to create process improvement in data collection, visualization, maintenance, reporting and analytics in support of the team as well as various organizations utilizing the information.
The Sr Specialist will collaborate with various groups for reporting and insights into the Fire Investigation data as well as analysis linking other data sets together and performing analysis through tools such as Python, SQL, PowerAutomate, PowerApps, and other such tools.

Title: Energy Analyst (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Supply Chain Analyst
**
*About AAK*
Making Better Happen
Everything AAK does is about Making Better Happen™. We specialize in plant-based oils that are the value-adding ingredients in many of the products people love to consume. We make these products better tasting, healthier, and more sustainable. At the heart of AAK’s offer is Customer Co-Development, combining our desire to understand what better means for each customer, with the unique flexibility of our production assets, and a deep knowledge of many products and industries, including Chocolate & Confectionery, Bakery, Dairy, Plant-based Foods, Special Nutrition, Foodservice and Personal Care. Our 4,000 employees support our close collaboration with customers through 25 regional sales offices, 15 dedicated Customer Innovation Centers, and with the support of more than 20 production facilities. Listed on Nasdaq Stockholm and with our headquarters in Malmö, Sweden, AAK has been Making Better Happen™ for more than 150 years.
Everything we do is about Making Better Happen together.
Join nearly 4,000 like-minded colleagues globally and build a better future with us.

Edison, NJ
**
*About the role*
Build a better future as a Supply Chain Analyst in Edison, NJ. The Supply Chain Analyst will have responsibility for the development, approval, quality, and accuracy of the demand forecast for our respective products through consolidation of all forecasting activities associated with customers and products within a monthly S&OP cycle. You will partner with the Sales, Marketing, Operations, IT, Sourcing & Trading and Finance departments to create the single forecast that drives oil procurement and forecasts the financial result. Additionally, you will support the transportation group in managing key performance reporting activities.
**
*Responsibilities*
Responsibilities will include:

Title: Energy Analyst (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
As Quality Assurance Specialist I (QAS I), this role is responsible, as a member of the Quality Assurance Unit (QAU), for assuring that the quality assurance programs are maintained in accordance to pertinent regulatory requirements in the performance of the duties of this position.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Provides on-the-floor day to day Quality support to laboratory operations.
Ability to perform final review of validation and sample analysis data.
Reviews and interacts with interdepartmental contacts on discrepancy assessment, resolution, and quality approval.
Collaborates with departments to ensure that all review activities are executed efficiently and effectively.
